intro: Chironia densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower chironia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, densely packed yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
